intro: Ipsea wrayana, commonly known as the Wray's ipsea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
